with this diagram this is a typical dev release process you make a feature
branch you make a commit and every commit you run unit tests and then when you're ready you wish you a pull request
someone reviews the code and then you push it into staging where you do your
depot deeper level of testing integration performance security testing licensing scanning all those kinds of
things now typically you can only do that once you reach staging because that's the only place where your
application can access all of its associated services its back-end the
basically the full application stack the result of this is that your staging step
becomes a huge bottleneck and it becomes a cost sink so if you think about it

cycles on computer yeah compute it's not a big deal so what we can do is actually
we can eliminate this and we can fix it by shifting left so this is what a shifted left pipeline looks like every

the service you're changing along with all of its dependent services to run not just unit tests but also integration
tests performance tests security tests even user acceptance testing before you
